biog.entry.name: CLARE, the Hon. Jason Dean
biog.entry.description: Biography for CLARE, the Hon. Jason Dean
biog.entry.electorate.name: Member for Blaxland (NSW)
biog.entry.title: Biography for CLARE, the Hon. Jason Dean
biog.entry.electorate.state.name: Member for Blaxland (NSW)
biog.entry.party.name: Australian Labor Party

parliamentary.service.title: Parliamentary Service
parliamentary.service.para: Elected to the House of Representatives for Blaxland, New South Wales, 2007, 2010 and 2013.

ministerial.appointments.title: Ministerial Appointments
ministerial.appointments.para: Parliamentary Secretary for Employment from 9.6.09 to 14.9.10.
Minister for Defence Materiel from 14.9.10 to 14.12.11 and from 5.3.12 to 4.2.13.
Minister for Home Affairs from 14.12.11 to 18.9.13.

committee.service.title: Committee Service
committee.service.para: House of Representatives Standing: Education and Training from 19.2.08 to 15.6.09; Infrastructure, Transport, Regional Development and Local Government from 19.2.08 to 15.6.09.
Joint Statutory: Australian Commission for Law Enforcement Integrity from 18.2.08 to 15.6.09; Intelligence and Security from 26.12.14.

parliamentary.party.positions.title: Parliamentary Party Positions
parliamentary.party.positions.para: Member, Opposition Shadow Ministry from 14.10.13. Shadow Minister for Communications from 18.10.13.

quals.work.pre.parliament.title: Qualifications and Occupation before entering Federal Parliament
quals.work.pre.parliament.para: Policy Adviser to the Minister for Police and Leader of the House (NSW), the Hon. PFP Whelan, MLA 1995-99.
Senior Policy Adviser to the Premier of NSW, the Hon. RJ Carr, MLA 1999-2003.

electorate.title: Electorate
electorate.para: Location: south western Sydney; it includes the suburbs of Bass Hill, Birrong, Carramar, Chester Hill, Condell Park, Fairfield East, Georges Hall, Guildford West, Old Guildford, Lansdowne, Potts Hill, Regents Park, Sefton, Villawood, Woodpark, Yagoona, Yennora, and parts of Auburn, Bankstown, Berala, Fairfield, Granville, Guildford, Merrylands, Smithfield and South Granville.
Industries: railway workshops, aircraft repairs, transport and storage industries.
State electorates: Blaxland includes parts of the New South Wales Legislative Assembly electorates of Auburn, Bankstown, East Hills, Fairfield and Granville.
